text:
MISCELLANEOUS MATERIAL
1
Pub!.
No.
Q-S The NAEB Radio-Television Bibliography - Burton Paulu
A listing of books and articles on all the nontechnical aspects
of broadcasting covering the period January 1, 1949 to June 30,
1952, 129 pp. Paper. $2.00
D-5. NAEB Directory of Members
The location, call letters, power and frequency, names and
telephone numbers of all NAEB members. February 1, 1959*
Paper. $2.00
Q-4 Clearance Rights and Legal Problems of Educational Radio and Television
Stations - Fredrick S. Siebert
A brief summary covering such points as "Common-Law Protection,"
"Copyright Protections"Use of Copyrighted Literary Materials,"
"Recording Rights," "Unfair Competition," "Privacy," and "Con¬
tractual Obligations." February, 1955. 6 pp. Paper. 500
D-7 Technical Direct cry - Cecil S. Bidlack, Editor
Listing of technical personnel at educational radio and television
stations, and production stations. February, 1957. 26 pp.
Paper. 500
P-5 NAEB Newsletter
The official monthly periodical of the National Association of
Educational Broadcasters. Approximately 10 pp. Paper. $5.00
per year. (Back issues 500 when available.)
P-7 NAEB Journal
A professional journal devoted to articles prepared by leaders
in the field of education and concerned with the utilization of
radio and television for education, as well as the specific field
of educational broadcasting. (Beginning with January, 1958, issue
includes NAEB ETV Fact Sheets formerly sold separately. These Fact
Sheets are an effort to digest and centralize available research,
principally on the effectiveness of radio and television as directly
instructional tools. Includes research into techniques of presen¬
tation, production principles, and content and audience research.)
Published eight time a year (monthly except June, July, August and
September). Approximately 50 pp. Paper. $4.00 per year. (Back
issues 500 when available.)
